title: Mark Treanor
text:
Mark Treanor (born 1 April 1963) is a Scottish former professional <a href="association%20football">football</a>er.
A <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">right-back</a>, <a href="Glasgow">Glasgow</a>-born Treanor began his career with <a href="Clydebank%20F.C.%20%281965%29">Clydebank</a> in 1979. In nine years with "the Bankies", he made 275 league appearances and scored 13 goals.
In 1988, he joined <a href="St%20Johnstone%20F.C.">St Johnstone</a> and went on to make 105 appearances for the <a href="Muirton%20Park">Muirton Park</a> club.
His next move, in 1992, was to <a href="Falkirk%20F.C.">Falkirk</a>, for whom he played three games. The following year he returned to his first club, Clydebank, making fourteen appearances and scoring two goals.
In 1994, he signed for <a href="Stranraer%20F.C.">Stranraer</a>, who would prove to be his final league club. He moved into junior football with <a href="Baillieston%20Juniors%20F.C.">Baillieston Juniors</a>, where he brought his playing career to a close.
